bow: am having very tough time waking my days old baby girl pls help can someone please give me tips on how to wake my baby for feeding every hours have tried tapping on forehead hands legs stomach chest nothing works she wakes up only when she wants to after hours which can not be tolerated as she has to be fed please help blow on her face baby wipe on her tummy clapping her hands or feet together blowing on my baby face always worked for me have you tried changing her diaper we would to undress her completely then change her diaper and while she was still just in her diaper and undressed try feeding her then guess it sounds bad but if she little cold or uncomfortable she ll wake up easier than if she so cozy we occasionally had to strip the baby down to just diaper so the cold would wake her up then my husband would tickle her to keep her awake while nursed also check with her ped or your health visitor at the next appointment most of the time if the baby has regained their birth weight you don have to worry about waking to feed good luck already tried witout any success yes tried but works out of times only why does she have to be woken up to be fed for my children did the time feeding except for when they sleep if baby is hunger she will wake up promise if you insist on waking her up have you tried to just slowly stick the nipple in her mouth babies have natural instinct to suck on anything that get put near their mouth it super mean but our nurses told us to lightly scratch the bottom of their feet to wake them up there reflex there only use if really necessary but sometimes you just have to make sure they re awake enough to eat obviously do scratch hard enough to leave marks or anything if she hasn regained her body weight yet she needs to be woken current recommendations are to do so until they ve gained at least back to birth weight afaik strip baby to diaper put cold pack like rice boo boo pack on her for few seconds until she stirs know it hard when you want to feed and go back to bed as soon as possible but it very normal for newborns to fall asleep while feeding talk to your pediatrician but pretty sure as long as you attempt for total of 10 minutes baby will get enough agree with letting babies eat when they re hungry within reason of course the only times they need to be fed like clockwork is if they re jaundiced sick or preemie this she has actually lost weight which is another issue struggling with let her sleep she ll wake when she hungry it very hard to regulate their eating and sleeping but with all of my children we allowed them to set their own schedule and all were sleeping through the night before they were months old meanwhile most of our friends were still training their babies good luck is there medical reason why she needs to be fed every two hours my doctor midwife nurses here in california just told me to feed my girl when she was hungry rooting around so she slept when she needed to and ate when she was hungry and gained weight just fine think the two hour advice is old school thinking unless there some kind of medical necessity slightly cold damp washcloth in the cheek hand somewhere only had to wake her to eat couple times in the beginning but when did this was the only thing that woke her up enough to actually eat cold wet wipe on the forehead and cheeks as well as bottom of her feet should work well worst case strip her down to diaper and cold wet wipe on the belly just make sure the diaper is on her she ll likely pee when that happens turn on soft light strip to diaper change her use wet wipe and then try to get her to latch had success running my finger from my sons ear to his mouth to wake him enough to latch and eat apparently it also stimulates reflex if that didn wake him up enough tickle his neck between swapping breasts reclothe and swaddle him so he could drift off to sleep comfortably we would put cold spoon under her little armpit and it worked really well also once you get her latched tickle below her chin when she slows down on suckling it takes forever when this little to get decent feeding in but this too shall pass listen to your pediatrician and wake baby for feedings or he or she will continue to lose weight had this problem too cool wet wash cloth wiped around baby head and face will do the trick about out of 10 times to wake him or her up also assuming you re breastfeeding so make sure you continue to wipe the washcloth on his or her face throughout the feeding otherwise they get super relaxed and just fall back asleep lastly using your fingernails gently to rub their scalp will help keep them awake too just want to tell you that you are doing an awesome job and good luck we used cool towels under my son armpits and that did the trick to keep him awake for feedings when he was tiny actually one reason babies can be so sleepy hard to wake is because they re not getting enough calories particularly if they have gained back their birth weight letting them sleep can be dangerous and cause undernourishment in those cases when babies are having trouble gaining back their birth weight it very important to make sure they re eating regularly one reason babies can be so sleepy is that they are getting enough calories to be awake leading to vicious cycle and malnourishment gt when babies are having trouble gaining back their birth weight it very important to make sure they re eating regularly one reason babies can be so sleepy is that they are getting enough calories to be awake leading to vicious cycle and malnourishment amp x200b let her sleep my son was premature and was supposed to eat every two hours he slept through feeding and called the pediatrician at like am freaking out because could get him up they told me if he skipped then to call but otherwise why would wake sleeping baby when my daughter was born fed on demand and honestly have no idea how frequently that was but she also dream nursed at times and whatnot so it was definitely longer than every two hours but while it is harder to measure remember thinking have wonderful baby get so much sleep personally say call your pediatrician at reasonable hour unlike me haha they know where your baby is at and what is appropriate for her not all babies eat the same way and if she is gaining as she should they re going to be happy with whatever call the pediatrician because sounds like there may be deeper rooted issue here if she constantly sleeping this soundly where you can only wake her to feed out of times my only other thought would be are you breastfeeding if yes it very hard to measure how much they are eating when they suckle but *look* asleep my newborn would latch for moment close his eyes and seemingly drift off but knew he was still getting good 3ish ounce feed at the beginning because we had lactation consultant come to our house for while and do weighted feeds when dd2 was 11 days old she started sleeping for five hour stretch in the middle of the night doc said that so long as she was still gaining weight it was totally fine to let her sleep it the worst we cheered when we did have to wake him up at night anymore at one point my husband dropped cold water into his diaper it was awful to do but it woke him up really quickly also wet paper towel on the back of neck armpit etc they told me to have my baby naked when feeding the cold wakes them up if my baby was sleeping and it was time to feed just pick her up and feed her you have to stick the nipple bottle in the mouth gently it called dream feeding if you are having trouble with your baby not waking up for feed and your baby is falling under weight see your pediatrician see what you pediatrician recommends before trying anything if you literally can wake your baby then you should go to the doctor and get jaundice levels checked again it sucks bad but it important when my daughter was doing this she was starving and dehydrated was nursing and thought she was getting enough did realize was producing next to nothing she was very difficult to wake up and she was expending an enormous amount of energy trying to nurse we went to her week check up and she was very very sick she ended up being hospitalized she strong and healthy now but your baby wo wake up call doctor right away my daughter was in similar situation and ended up needing to be hospitalized was nursing but was producing even close to enough but did realize it please be very careful newborns can end up extremely sick very very fast my daughter had jaundice and was hard to wake the nurse told us to undress her down to her diaper and put cold washcloth on her that worked the best every newborn loses weight our dr said 10 loss or less is ok our oldest lost 11 and they were so annoying about what was literally like an ounce off they made us give the bay formula while in the office and promise to supplement with formula they had us going to the dr every other day for weight checking it was emotionally hard but the kid is fine don know how much weight loss you re dealing with and if she still losing or is now gaining idk how small she is idk if your using boobs or bottles or both you might need to wake the baby to keep her eating but generally speaking kids know when they re hungry and imagine you and your doctors will be checking her weight to make sure it on the right track know nothing about you but just remember to keep breathing you re doing great my baby was too sleepy in the hospital and one thing that worked was pumping colostrum and then using syringe to put it in her mouth the taste would wake her up and then try to latch her on as others have said this is not normal and very concerning as this sounds like the result of not getting enough milk if you are nursing please reach out to your pediatrician for medical advice and support if you are providing formula using the tips including frozen peas cola spoons in the armpit should work enough to wake her to drink if not you need to contact your pediatrician because you need immediate medical attention to keep her safe and well wishing you luck op said she has lost weight and needs to regain in this case it is necessary to wake every two hours to feed once baby gains weight then op can do more time between feeds good tip alternatively you can tap or flick the soles of their feet rather hard if need be it shouldn hurt them just startle them awake was the baby low in birth weight we had this problem and the nurse at the hospital lightly ran an ice cube over her skin so it seems that lot of the suggestions here for cold spoons or wipes should be ok call her pediatrician and let them know what is going on and see what they advise as others here have pointed out there are variety of reasons she may be so hard to wake ranging from the benign to extremely dangerous why risk it you are definitely not the first nor the last mother to be in this situation you re doing great hang in there and never hesitate to call your pediatrician day or night it what they are there for and what they want you to do you ve got this nope nope so like other have said definitely contact your pediatrician right away or even head up to urgent care er babies can get dehydrated so quickly it scary my son who was 10 months at the time had stomach bug and was throwing up was exclusively pumping at the time but he still was taking in enough liquids we went to the er and he had to be admitted and put on an iv the younger baby is the faster dehydration becomes extremely dangerous always struggled to make sure my son ate enough still am at years actually since pumped tried so many things spoon feeding syringe feeding putting my milk in squirt bottle and gently squirting it in his mouth squeezing the nipple of the bottle so it would drip faster if you re breastfeeding try pumping to see how much your baby takes in at time or supplement with formula always remember no matter what anyone says fed is best whether that be from the breast or bottle good luck mama you re doing an awesome job ah got it didn read her follow up comments just thought she was under the impression she needed to wake baby up for some reason please take her to doctor or hospital difficulty waking baby this young can be sign of low blood sugar especially if she is eating only every six hours this advice works later on but not for four day old they really do need to eat frequently to avoid low blood sugar this is wrong in very young babies they become lethargic when their blood sugar is low or they are not getting enough calories this op really suggest seeing your pediatrician asap and explaining how difficult it is to wake her this seems really concerning drowsy baby from time to time is something we all expect but what you describe in your post amp responses is extreme yep had to strip mine down for while to get her to wake up once she had regained plus some birth weight didn have to do it anymore this exactly we had this kind of problem because of jaundice too op needs to get her baby levels checked asap we would pull up on his arms like the doctors did when they do his check ups kind of hold his hands and straighten them out lifting him little envy their ability to sleep sometimes changing the diaper unswaddling worked for us this is how the pediatric recovery nurses wake patients after general anesthesia so probably pretty safe and well endorsed method had to do this with both my girls as well my pediatrician also said if it was really difficult to use cool washcloth on her skin as well felt so bad but you do what you got ta do have you had the baby checked for jaundice we had to undress our daughter and make her tad uncomfortable cool air annoying tickles to get her to wake up enough to eat those first few nights home my baby girl was very sleepy and difficult to wake for while too it got lot better once she really put some weight on please do speak to your dr to rule out any medical issues and then here are some things that worked for us sometimes it was pretty frustrating but hang in there rubbing feet hands arms bicycle kicking her legs gently blowing on her face changing her diaper stripping her down to just her diaper gently tickling her belly feet ears face gentle pokes taps scratching up and down her back try to keep all of this very irregular steady rhythm is soothing and may make her even sleepier but random pattern is more disorienting and better at waking them if necessary cool not cold damp washcloth on the belly or dabbed around her face blowing raspberries on her belly and feet gently bouncing her with cheerful brrrr brrr bup bup time to get up noises sing song kind of the opposite of shushing and rocking to sleep if you are breastfeeding sometimes when tried to get her interested in the nipple would squirt some on her lips face and she would wake up haha if she will suck on finger or something in her sleep you can try to quickly swap it out for your nipple or the bottle think indiana jones lol for dream feed we had the same problem please take her to the doctor good luck and great on you for reaching out mine had jaundice and was hard to keep awake had to strip her down and roll her from side to side on her back while talking to her and it would wake her up the pediatrician told me to pinch her heels if she started falling asleep mid feed but only did that once or twice get her to doctor too but remember that the most important indicator is how many dirty diapers she making not how often or how long she eating keep tracking her wet and poop diapers closely and get some rest yourself yep similar story for me though we were bit luckier and did end up getting hospitalized ve now learned the reason why my ped office has nurse line and walk in appointments us because when babies act funny it better to get them checked out stat don wake her up every hours let her go hours ll just add my experience for what it worth my newborn slept from about 9:30 pm until am almost immediately from birth for the first months she cluster fed until she fell asleep for the night woke around 5am for feeding and then back to bed until around am or so when she cluster fed for another couple of hours it very unusual but since the pediatrician said she was gaining weight she said not to worry about it since she voraciously feeding otherwise to note she didn sleep during huge chunks of the day like most newborns would add that normal is range between two extremes if your pediatrician is not concerned and your baby is otherwise eating and sleeping with plenty of bowel movements and urination you may just be very very lucky all the best to you yep this happened to us we were told this or also to try flicking the ears not hard enough to hurt just to annoy them awake had this problem with my son he had jaundice strip her off and tickle her feet if she still wo wake up and feed go straight to hospital have you been instructed to feed every hours regardless because if baby back up to birth weight then you should have to wake her up to eat unless the doctor instructed you to obviously our daughter was the same so we just give her warm up and spend while waking her up gently open the door of the bedroom turn on the light unswaddle her change her diaper turn on some music tv show talk to my husband and eventually she be awake enough to eat it took so long sometimes 20 or 30 minutes strip and tickle to keep awake also check jaundice levels with midwife that happened with me although we didn have to hospitalize number is due next month and have whole stock of nursette bottles for when he comes home now know what my boobs look and feel like when my milk comes in my doc told me to stop that she will wake up when she is hungry every hours is suggestion as long as each pediatric visit she is gaining weight relax is she gaining weight don think so used an alarm clock and would try to feed my kid every few hours without success she told me when she was hungry my ped laughed at me he said my daughter is gaining weight don force feed her he said let her tell me when she was ready to nurse same with my two kids would agree with the advice here you should speak to pediatrician you need to know if she is gaining weight and has she regained her birth weight yet it is normal particularly for bf babies to lose up to 10 of their birth weight but you would want them to be gaining that back asap and before weeks old if you are breastfeeding is she having wet and dirty nappies wet and one dirty in 24 hours at days 5+1 at days if she is not having many wet or dirty nappies she may not be effectively feeding and would need to have her latch and positioning checked by bf support worker and ideally be checked for tongue ties would hold her in both hands with one hand supporting her neck and head belly up and lift her quickly up about 30cm and then down 3cm this would activate her startle reflex and wake her up enough that she could feed but even though that worked to wake her up little more it wasn enough to get her to eat what she needed she had jaundice pretty bad needed medical intervention please go to the hospital even if it nothing go better safe than sorry not at days old the op literally said her baby is having hard time gaining weight and not when they were gaining weight we didn have jaundice but my baby needed tiny bit of supplementation but you need advice from lactation consultant as had to feed supplement then pump at every feed the first few weeks yeah we stocked up on supplemental formula and were much quicker to recognize the signs of tongue and lip tie with my second that was the underlying cause of my low supply with my oldest live and learn congratulations on number if the baby is healthy has normal weight and she only wakes up when she wants then let it happen maybe she small but she knows the best what she needs and what the best for herself both my boys had jaundice due to abo incompatibility and they were both sleepy like this had to supplement bit with my oldest to get his bilirubin levels down and he eventually pooped them out but my youngest got sleepier and would take the bottle he went from little yellow so let wait and see in the hospital to dangerously high bilirubin levels by day at his check up he needed light therapy you came here because you feel something isnt right go with your gut mama and call the pediatrician you didnt do anything wrong they wont berate you and it will at worst ease your mind try stroking her cheek especially with your nipple it can stimulate the rooting reflex and make her open her mouth to latch on even if she does wake try expressing bit of milk and rubbing it over her lips too but definitely see doctor asap if she is lethargic and hard to wake in general that seems worrying how many wet and poopy diapers is she producing day your baby output will give you an idea of the amount of milk she getting it important that babies have at least heavy wet diapers in 24 hour period breast fed babies may poop frequently and formula fed babies tend not to poop as frequently if she producing heavy wet diapers day then she likely getting enough each feed your babe could also just be more inclined to go longer between feeds my daughter could go hour stretches right off the hop although did allow that often in the beginning normally babe will wake to feed when they re ready but we cant apply that to newborns the longest let little one under weeks go between feeds would be hours but as with anything mama if you re concerned or your gut is telling you something off consult with your doctor or midwife uh both of my babies slept for hours each night with no feedings in the first weeks did wake them up they were fine doctors said it was fine their weight was fine it okay it normal we had this issue when ours was born early and jaundiced nothing could wake her and we ended up having to put cold water on the palms of her hands and bottoms of her feet as per our pediatricians suggestion was the first insanely hard thing we had to do as parents and was crazy upsetting for everybody thankfully only had to do it for short while and then she started regaining weight but man hang in there sure this has been suggested but maybe buy the expensive alumentium formula and prepare 4oz in bottles ahead of time then keep those bottles and jug of baby water next to the rocking chair and if baby doesnt take enough breast milk you can make bottle on the spot never heated up formula just shook the bottle well and my daughter didnt care also check your pediatrician if to days go by with no improvement definitely by noon the third day am not professional but just never let baby go past hours per my lc if baby seems healthy but baby just won eat let baby sleep you rest too but don go past hours usually baby would eat of her own before then or we would strip her down and make her cool to get her to wake up enough to eat wet wipes to the face work every time for me my wife had this issue but she found he never needed to be woke before hand simply putting him in the position to be fed and putting the nipple in his mouth made him start feeding not sure how much you ve tried so far in our case we tried every tip on this thread and then some multiple doctors and lactation consultants said it was fine and kept giving the standard tips until one doctor in the er where we were for jaundice which is sometimes caused by under eating told us to see yet another lactation consultant she gave the standard tips but then she stuck around for couple of hours to see full cycle and she was surprised to see how poorly it went she said there was plenty of milk but baby was not getting much because he was too tired to work at it she said it downward spiral where lack of food causes tiredness and then the baby gets even less food she had me pump and give bottle after every feed for few weeks because bottles are less work for the baby it was exhausting but after two weeks the baby started to wake up with normal strategies like cold washcloth on his back he also gained weight quickly you need to get your baby to the ped asap this is huge cause of concern and could be due to various factors ranging from underfeeding to jaundice rub her elbow the inner crease take off her clothes run an ice cube on their feet or scalp that normal what op is describing is not thank you my case is also following on the same lines am feeding her using the spoon instead of bottle as per the lactacian advice hey there jiguji just wanted to check in on you to see if anything has changed or if you ve been able to get to the doctor haven been able to stop thinking about your and your new baby and these struggles you were are having also want to say that you re doing great job the first few months are by far the hardest but each day we become better parents than the one before ❤️ hi thank you for your kind words really mean it we are still struggling doctors said possible dehydration due to poor feeding jaundice was in control and asked us to consult with lactacian which we did she said it probably due to less feeding which is another issue due to poor latching she held the baby while was feeding my baby and the session went fine but when hold the baby and breast baby does suck even for seconds lactacian told will learn it only after experience till then have to keep trying ped has also prescribed formula for the emergency which has become regular in the night am also using pump to express the milk but dr has asked to not to use bottle however could not resist today anymore started to feed my baby with my pumped milk using bottle and the difference is quite clear baby is really calm for the first time and it shows on her lil face am going to continue this until my next appointment on wednesday am doing this against the advise but ca see my baby crying with hunger my entire family is with me to support my idea of feeding baby with my bottled milk sorry for the long reply and thank you for showing your concern it shows that my baby is in world where good ppl still exists pumping and feeding sounds like an amazing option for you its wonderful that it working and your baby is getting the nourishment it needs some doctors have an inappropriate obsession on only breastfeeding that is not the only way to feed your baby and what you are doing sounds like it is best would actually urge you to get second opinion for couple of reasons the laser focus on breastfeeding and the obvious guilt the doctor is pushing on you and because waiting week to being baby back in for checkup with dehydration and starvation is possible issue is practically negligent my cousin had extreme difficulty breastfeeding as well and was at the doctors office every couple of days for weigh ins and doing weighted feeds she wasn able to breastfeed ultimately and was able to get her baby into formula early enough on that it made an incredible difference for both her and the baby your mental health is so so important and if pumping and bottle feeding gives you the assurance that your baby is getting the nourishment it needs then please do that and if formula feels like better option please go that route you do not have to breastfeed you are not at all failure you are so obviously loving concerned new mom and your support team doctor included should be backing you up in your decisions not pushing you to keep going with something that may not work please reach out to me via dm if you need any moral support or personal cheerleading would be happy to help you along as mom of an almost year old the trials and tribulations of having newborn are not far from my memory ❤️ thank you so much for all this can not express it how grateful am for your kind words may god give you and your family health wealth and much much happiness not the person you replied to but ve been thinking about your post all day and am so glad to see this update fed baby is the happiest baby gave pumped milk in bottle as well as nursed from few days old and the combination of pumping and nursing helped my milk supply increase best of luck with your baby fed is best what no this is terribly advice this is four day old that is losing weight it doesn say in op that baby is losing weight here in uk midwives advise feeding baby every hours though if they re sleeping don let them go longer than paper we drew thank you any update on your daughter ve been thinking about you guys ❤️ apologize for not posting the updates regularly it is see saw ride for me baby not waking up is no more prime issue now the main issue is the poor latching due to flat nipple last week due to excessive weight loss took help of formula and bottle feed yesterday visited the pediatrician as per my schedule and found that baby has gained some weight which is relieving when doctors heard me saying used pump and the bottle they were annoyed and scolded me like made some crime they said that if continue to use bottle to feed my breast milk then it is guaranteed that within 30 days my body will stop producing milk they there was panel of drs written different problems which arises for using bottle to feed new borns they cited some who reference they have advised me to use nip shield that too in worst case otherwise have to keep practicing breast feeding and keep seeing my baby crying due to hunger baby stays hungry even after hours of feeding session which makes me assume that milk quantity was not enough for her and now dont have option to use bottle so in nutshell am struggling with feeding now hope my baby doesnt loose weight again thank you for thinking about me my fellow redditor it helps when you know that someone thinks about your misery god bless you you will figure this out heard myself through your text had twins as my first children they were low birth weight and struggled to nurse not telling you what to do here but
